ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course, I would recommend it.

This is a fantastic class, with interesting and extremely relevant course material about the diaspora, a very reasonable workload, and an incredible professor! The workload this semester also included a panel discussion based Kahani workshop with eminent Hindi diaspora writers, which was an illuminating experience. Class with Seema Ji is a joy to attend. She was extremely accommodating and always responsive to her studentsâ needs. She led the class in a way that encouraged free and uninhibited discussion â which fostered a truly effective learning environment. A masterful writer herself, her opinions on current Hindi diaspora writing were always a treat to listen to, and her amiable nature made her feel like a friend to us all! Take this class even if you arenât interested in the diaspora, just because Seema Ji is so awesome!

Absolutely -- this course provides incredible insight for both heritage and non-heritage students alike. I learned a lot from the class and truly appreciated every class activity, whether it was reading/writing, or even hearing popular works from the visiting professor (and talented writer), Susham Bedi! Definitely relatable if you are of South Asian descent in a non-South Asian country.
I would recommend this class to every student at Yale. Take it!!!
